children.name: to make a list, or include sb/sth on a list
make a list
children.definition: tạo một danh sách

children.name: make a list of
examples: She made a list of all the things she would need on her trip.
A list has been made of all students who failed to attend lectures regularly.

children.name: list
children.definition: to give a list of names, places etc, or to include sb/sth on a list:tạo danh sách / ghi vào danh sách

children.name: a useful booklet, listing all the colleges that take part-time students
examples: The books are listed alphabetically, according to the name of the author.

children.name: list as
examples: Chapman lists rugby as one of his hobbies.

children.name: catalogue
children.definition: especially UK/catalogUS  to make a well-arranged list of a large group of things so that people can find what they want: ghi vào mục lục
examples: We are still waiting for all the paintings to be identified and catalogued.

children.name: itemize
children.definition: to write down all the separate parts or details of sth in a list: ghi thành từng khoản
examples: Donleavy carefully itemized the equipment.
Make sure the bill you receive is itemized and shows the individual price of each job that has been done.

children.name: shortlist
children.definition: UK to include sb on a small list of people, chosen from a larger group, from which you choose one person for a job: danh sách rút gọn
examples: Three candidates have been shortlisted for the job.

children.name: register
children.definition: an official list containing the names of all the people, organizations, or things of a particular type: danh sách , sổ
examples: register of sổ của
▪ a register of qualified translators
▪ a civil register of births, deaths, and marriages
electoral registeran official list of people who can vote in an election
▪ Make sure your name is on the electoral register in good time.

children.name: list
children.definition: a set of the names of people in a particular place, on a course etc, written one below the other and kept as a record: danh sách

children.name: list of
examples: ▪ A list of competitors will be posted on the main notice board.

children.name: waiting lista list of people who are waiting to do something
examples: ▪ I’m afraid the English course is already full, and there is a waiting list.

children.name: guest list
examples: ▪ This is the guest list for the wedding.

children.name: draw up a list
examples: ▪ I drew up a list of all the jobs I had to do in the house.

children.name: cross sb off the listremove someone’s name from a list
examples: ▪ Sarah’s name had been crossed off the list of candidates.

children.name: shortlist
children.definition: short list/ UK a list of the most suitable people for a job or a prize, chosen from all the people who were first considered : danh sách rút gọn

children.name: on/onto a shortlist (for something)
examples: You were lucky to even get onto the shortlist.
Davies was on the shortlist for the Booker Prize.

children.name: draw up/compile a shortlist (of people)
examples: After the first set of interviews, we will draw up a shortlist of candidates we wish to interview a second time.
The panel will draw up a shortlist of candidates.

children.name: roll
children.definition: an official list of the names of people at a meeting, in a class etc: danh sách
examples: The school now has a roll of over 2,000 children.

children.name: on a roll
examples: His name was not on the voters’ roll.
Is your name on theelectoralroll(= the list of people who can vote)?

children.name: roster
children.definition: a list of people and the jobs they each have to do: danh sách
examples: If you look on the duty roster, you'll see when you're working.

children.name: roster for
examples: We organized a roster for cleaning the house.

children.name: on a roster
examples: I noticed that my name was not on the night duty roster.

children.name: a list of things, places, etc
checklist
children.definition: a list of things you need or things you have to do which you keep in order to help you remember them: danh sách
examples: Use a checklist when visiting properties to buy, so that you keep a record of which features youliked and didn’t like.

children.name: a useful/handy checklist
examples: This is a useful checklist for anyone travelling abroad.

children.name: a quick checklist
examples: Here’s a quick checklist of things you are likely to need.

children.name: a mental checklist
children.definition: a list you keep in your mind
examples: I try and keep a mental checklist of jobs I have to do.

children.name: a holiday checklist
examples: A holiday checklist is useful when you are packing.

children.name: keep a checklist
examples: Can you keep a checklist of what we need to buy?

children.name: use a checklist
examples: Interviewers often use a checklist to ensure that they’ve covered everything.

children.name: draw up/produce a checklist
children.definition: make one
examples: Why not draw up a checklist of things you want to achieve this year?

children.name: go/run through a checklist
children.definition: read it to see what still needs doing
examples: I’ll just run through the checklist one more time.

children.name: checklist of
examples: Here is a checklist of things you need to buy before travelling to India.
The guide contains a useful checklist of points to look for when buying a car.

children.name: list
children.definition: a set of names, numbers etc, usually written one below the other, for example so that you can remember or check them

children.name: make/draw up/write a list
examples: Could you make a list of any supplies we need?

children.name: compile a listformal
children.definition: write a list
examples: They’ve compiled a list of children’s clubs and organizations.

children.name: put somebody/something on a list
examples: I was put on a waiting list to see a specialist at the hospital.

children.name: top a list
children.definition: be the first thing in a list
examples: The novel topped the best-seller list.

children.name: at the top/bottom of a list
examples: Her name was at the top of the list of students.

children.name: first/last on a list
examples: Your name will be first on my list.|Why am I always last on the list?

children.name: long/short
examples: He read out a long list of errors.

children.name: a complete/full/comprehensive list
examples: The full list of winners is on page seven.

children.name: a price list
examples: We’ll send you a catalog and price list.

children.name: a shopping list
children.definition: a list of things you want to buy
examples: a Christmas shopping list

children.name: a grocery listAmerican English
children.definition: a list of food you want to buy
examples: Did you put milk on the grocery list?

children.name: a wine list
children.definition: a list of wines available in a restaurant
examples: a good wine list

children.name: a waiting list
children.definition: a list of people who are waiting for something
examples: If you don’t get the class you want, you can put your name on a waiting list.

children.name: a mailing list
children.definition: a list of people that a company sends information to
examples: If you do not want to be on our mailing list, please tick the box below.

children.name: a guest list
children.definition: a list of people invited somewhere
examples: the guest list for the wedding reception

children.name: a to-do list
children.definition: a list of things you must do
examples: Painting the bedroom is at the top of my to-do list.

children.name: a hit list
children.definition: a list of people, organizations etc that someone wants to harm or stop

children.name: list of
examples: Make a list of all the things you have to do.

children.name: on/in a list
examples: The first person on my list is Mrs Gilling.

children.name: inventory
children.definition: an official list of all the objects in a house, factory, or shop, written so that you can know exactly what is there: bản kiểm kê

children.name: in/on an inventory
examples: ▪ Some of the things in the shop were not listed in the inventory.

children.name: inventory of
examples: ▪ The company keeps a full inventory of its equipment.

children.name: make an inventory
examples: ▪ She made an inventory of everything in the apartment.

children.name: catalogue
children.definition: especially UK /catalogUS  a list that gives some information about each thing in a library, art collection etc so that people can find what they want: mục lục, bảng tổng kê
examples: ▪ There is a new catalogue of all the books in the library.
▪ You will find information about all the sale items in our catalog.

children.name: a list of events or activities
agenda
children.definition: a list of the subjects that will be discussed at a meeting:chương trình nghị sự
examples: ▪ Have you got a copy of the agenda for tomorrow’s meeting?

children.name: on an agenda
examples: ▪ What do you do if you want to discuss something that’s not on the agenda?

children.name: (at the) top of an agenda
examples: The fuel crisis will be at the top of the agenda for today’s board meeting.

children.name: programme
children.definition: UK /programUS  a list of all the activities or events that have been planned, especially one that shows when each event will happen: kế hoạch
examples: programme of
A spectacular program of exhibitions, displays and competitions has been planned.
Because of bad weather, our programme of events has had to be changed slightly.
a programme of exhibitions throughout the year
programme for
What’s the programme for tomorrow?
on a programme
First on the programme is a speech by the organizer, Mrs Jenkins.

children.name: schedule
children.definition: a list of events or activities that shows when each one will happen: lịch trình
examples: According to the schedule, the first lecture begins at 9.00 am.
The President’s schedule included a visit to a children’s hospital.
